title: Runoff

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

title: Surface runoff

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.

title: Subsurface runoff
comment: Sum of water that flows out from subsurface layer(s) including the groundwater layer (if present). Equals qg in case of a groundwater layer below only one soil layer.

title: Groundwater recharge

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Water that percolates through the soil layer(s) into the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.

title: Groundwater runoff
comment: Water that leaves the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.

title: Discharge

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: River discharge or streamflow. Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

title: Evapotranspiration

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.

title: Potential Evapotranspiration

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: As evap, but with all resistances set to zero, except the aerodynamic resistance.

title: Soil moisture for each layer

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

title: Soil moisture, root zone

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Total simulated soil moisture available for evapotranspiration. Please indicate the depth of the root zone for each vegetation type in your model. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

title: Frozen soil moisture for each layer
comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m.

title: Temperature of Soil
comment: Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". This is the most important variable for the permafrost sector. If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

title: Snow depth
comment: Grid cell mean depth of snowpack. This variable only for the purposes of the permafrost sector.

title: Snow water equivalent

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell. Please also deliver for the permafrost sector.

title: Total water storage
comment: Mean monthly water storage in all compartments. Please indicate in the netcdf metadata which storage compartments are considered.

title: Canopy water storage
comment: Mean monthly water storage in the canopy.

title: Glacier storage
comment: Mean monthly water storage in glaciers.

title: Groundwater storage
comment: Mean monthly water storage in groundwater layer.

title: Lake storage
comment: Mean monthly water storage in lakes (except reservoirs).

title: Wetland storage
comment: Mean monthly water storage in wetlands.

title: River storage
comment: Mean monthly water storage in rivers.

title: Reservoir storage
comment: Mean monthly water storage in reservoirs.

title: Annual maximum thaw depth
comment: Calculated from daily thaw depths.

title: River temperature
comment: Mean monthly water temperature in river (representative of the average temperature across the channel volume).

title: Potential irrigation water withdrawal (assuming unlimited water supply)

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Irrigation water withdrawn in case of optimal irrigation (in addition to rainfall), assuming no losses in conveyance and application.

title: Actual irrigation water withdrawal

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Irrigation water withdrawal, taking water availability into account; please provide if computed.

title: Potential irrigation water consumption

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, assuming unlimited water supply.

title: Actual irrigation water consumption

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, taking water availability into account; if computed.

title: Actual green water consumption on irrigated cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed.

title: Potential green water consumption on irrigated cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Potential evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed and different from AIrrUseGreen.

title: Actual green water consumption on rainfed cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over rainfed cropland; if computed.

title: Actual domestic water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Actual domestic water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Actual manufacturing water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Actual manufacturing water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Actual electricity water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Actual electricity water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Actual livestock water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Actual livestock water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Potential domestic water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Potential domestic water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Potential manufacturing water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Potential manufacturing water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Potential electricity water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Potential electricity water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Potential livestock water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Potential livestock water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Total (all sectors) actual water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Total (all sectors) actual water consumption
comment: Sum of actual water consumption from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

title: Total (all sectors) potential water withdrawal
comment: Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) water withdrawal from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

title: Total (all sectors) potential water consumption
comment: Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) water consumption from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

title: Actual industrial water consumption
comment: If computed.

title: Actual industrial water withdrawal
comment: If computed.

title: Soil types
comment: Soil types or texture classes as used by your model. Please include a description of each type or class, especially if these are different from the standard HSWD and GSWP3 soil types. Please also include a description of the parameters and values associated with these soil types (parameter values could be submitted as spatial fields where appropriate).

title: Crop yields
unit: dry matter (t ha-1 per growing season)
comment: Crop-specific: Yield may be identical to above-ground biomass (biom) if the entire plant is harvested, e.g. for bioenergy production.

title: Actual evapotranspiration
comment: Portion of all water (including rain) that is evapo-transpired, the water amount should be accumulated over the entire growing period (not the calendar year)

title: Nitrogen application rate
comment: Total nitrogen application rate. If organic and inorganic amendments are applied, rate should be reported as effective inorganic nitrogen input (ignoring residues).

title: Actual planting dates
comment: Julian dates.

title: Actual planting year
comment: This allows for clear identification of planting that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project

title: Anthesis dates
comment: Together with the year of anthesis added to the list of outputs (see below) it allows for clear identification of anthesis that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

title: Year of anthesis
comment: It allows for clear identification of anthesis that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

title: Maturity dates
comment: Together with the year of maturity added to the list of outputs (see below) it allows for clear identification of maturity that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

title: Year of maturity
comment: It allows for clear identification of maturity that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

title: Above ground biomass (dry matter)
comment: The whole plant biomass above ground.

title: Soil carbon emissions
comment: Ideally should be modeled with realistic land-use history and initial carbon pools. Subject to extra study.

title: Nitrous oxide emissions
comment: Ideally should be modeled with realistic land-use history and initial carbon pools. Subject to extra study.

title: Total N uptake (total growing season sum)
comment: Nitrogen balance: uptake

title: Total N inputs (total growing season sum)
comment: Nitrogen balance: inputs

title: Total N losses (total growing season sum)
comment: Nitrogen balance: losses

title: Growing season precipitation
comment: Total growing season precipitation per crop

title: Growing season radiation
comment: Average growing season shortwave solar radiation

title: Growing season temperature sum
comment: Sum of daily mean temperature over growing season

title: Amphibian species probability of occurrence
comment: Results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Terrestrial bird species probability of occurrence
comment: Results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Terrestrial mammal species probability of occurrence
comment: Results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Amphibian summed probability of occurrence
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Terrestrial bird summed probability of occurrence
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Terrestrial mammal summed probability of occurrence
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Summed probability of endemic amphibian species
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Summed probability of endemic terrestrial bird species
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Summed probability of endemic terrestrial mammal species
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Summed probability of threatened amphibian species
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Summed probability of threatened terrestrial bird species
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Summed probability of threatened terrestrial mammal species
unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

title: Amphibian species richness
unit: Estimated number of species (species richness) per cell
comment: Results from macroecological richness models

title: Terrestrial bird species richness
unit: Estimated number of species (species richness) per cell
comment: Results from macroecological richness models

title: Terrestrial mammal species richness
unit: Estimated number of species (species richness) per cell
comment: Results from macroecological richness models

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻². Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon Mass in aboveground vegetation biomass

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻²Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon Mass in belowground vegetation biomass

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻². Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Species information is essential. Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

comment.biomes: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. Species information is essential.
comment.fire: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.fire: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation.  If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.forestry: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.permafrost: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.

title: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change

comment.biomes: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.
comment.fire: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.
comment.forestry: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.

title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and Species information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and species information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and species information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and Species information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO₂ Emission from Fire

comment.biomes: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time of the given day/month/year (for daily/monthly/annual resolution)
comment.permafrost: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time of the given day/month/year (for daily/monthly/annual resolution)

title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and species information is essential.

title: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change
comment: For wood products only. Sum of CO2 fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emsissions from previous years

title: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Grazing
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Crop Harvesting
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation to Litter
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil
comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Fraction of absorbed photosynthetically active radiation
comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Stand total and species information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.water_global: If used by, or computed by the model.

title: Plant Functional Type Grid Fraction
comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land.

title: Evaporation from Canopy (interception)
comment: The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

title: Water Evaporation from Soil
comment: Includes sublimation.

title: Carbon Mass in Wood
comment: Including sapwood and hardwood.

title: Carbon Mass in Roots
comment: Including fine and coarse roots.

title: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debros
comment: Including fine and coarse roots.

title: Mean DBH of 100 highest trees
comment: 100 highest trees per hectare.

title: Stand Height
comment: For models including natural regeneration this variable may not make sense, please report domhei.

title: Dominant Height
comment: Mean height of the 100 highest trees per hectare.

title: Harvest by DBH-class
comment: DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

title: Remaining stem number after disturbance and management by dbh class
comment: DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

title: Tree age by dbh class
comment: DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

title: Net Ecosystem Exchange
comment: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹

title: Removed stem numbers by DBH class by natural mortality
comment: As trees per hectare. DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

title: Removed stem numbers by DBH class by management
comment: As trees per hectare. DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

title: Nitrogen of annual Litter
comment: As g Nitrogen m-2 a-1

title: Nitrogen in Soil
comment: As g Nitrogen m-2 a-1

title: Thermal stratification
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: 1 if lake grid cell is thermally stratified, 0 if lake grid cell is not thermally stratified

title: Depth of Thermocline
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth corresponding the maximum water density gradient

title: Water temperature
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Full Profile. Simulated water temperature. Layer averages and full profiles.

title: Surface temperature
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Average of the upper layer in case not simulated directly.

title: Bottom temperature
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Average of the lowest layer in case not simulated directly.

title: Lake ice cover
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: 1 if ice cover is present in lake grid cell, 0 if no ice cover is present in lake grid cell

title: Lake layer ice mass fraction
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Mean epi. Fraction of mass of a given layer taken up by ice.

title: Ice thickness
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

title: Snow thickness
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

title: Temperature at the ice upper surface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

title: Temperature at the snow upper surface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

title: Sensible heat flux at the lake-atmosphere interface

resolution.lakes_global: Representative lake associated with grid cell
resolution.lakes_local: Representative lake associated with grid cell

comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.

title: Latent heat flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.

title: Momentum flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.

title: Upward shortwave radiation flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. Not to be confused with net shortwave radiation.

title: Upward longwave radiation flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. Not to be confused with net longwave radiation.

title: Downward heat flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. the residual term of the surface energy balance, i.e. the net amount of energy that enters the lake on daily time scale: lakeheatf = swdown - swup + lwdown - lwup - sensheatf - latenheatf (terms defined positive when directed upwards)

title: Turbulent diffusivity of heat
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Only if computed by the model.

title: Surface albedo of lake
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Albedo of the lake surface interacting with the atmosphere (water, ice or snow).

title: Surface albedo of land
comment: Albedo of the land surface interacting with the atmosphere. Average of pfts, snow cover, bare ground.

title: Light extinction coefficient
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Only to be reported for global models, local models should use extcoeff as input.

title: Sediment upward heat flux at the lake-sediment interface
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Positive if upwards. Only if computed by the model.

title: Chlorophyll Concentration
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Total water chlorophyll concentration – indicator of phytoplankton.

title: Phytoplankton Functional group biomass
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Different models will have different numbers of functional groups so that the reporting of these will vary by model.

title: Phytoplankton Functional group biomass
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Total simulated Zooplankton biomass.

title: Total Phosphorus
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

title: Particulate Phosphorus
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

title: Total Dissolved Phosphorus
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Some models may also output data for soluble reactive phosphorus (SRP).

title: Total Nitrogen
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

title: Particulate Nitrogen
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

title: Total Dissolved Nitrogen
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Some models may also output data for Nitrate (N02) nitrite (NO3) and ammonium (NH4).

title: Dissolved Oxygen
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

title: Dissolved Organic Carbon
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Not always available.

title: Dissolved Silica
resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Not always available.

title: TOTAL system biomass density
comment: all primary producers and consumers

title: TOTAL consumer biomass density
comment: all consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)

title: Biomass density of consumers >10cm
comment: if L infinity is >10 cm, include in >10 cm class

title: Biomass density of consumers >30cm
comment: if L infinity is >30 cm, include in >30 cm class

title: TOTAL Catch (all commercial functional groups / size classes)
comment: catch at sea (commercial landings plus discards, fish and invertebrates)

title: TOTAL Landings (all commercial functional groups / size classes)
comment: commercial landings (catch without discards, fish and invertebrates)

title: Biomass density of commercial species
comment: Discarded species not included (Fish and invertebrates)

title: Biomass density of large consumers >90cm and <100kg
Biomass density of medium consumers >30cm and <90cm
Biomass density (by functional group / size class)
comment: Provide name of each size class (<class>) and functional group (<group>) used, and provide a definition of each class/group.

title: Catch (by functional group / size class)
comment: Provide name of each size class (<class>) and functional group (<group>) used, and provide a definition of each class/group.

title: Number of deaths attributable to cold
comment: For ERF models, this occurs when temperature is below threshold (e.g., minimum mortality temperature (MMT)). Report 0 if temperature above threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

title: Number of deaths attributable to heat
comment: Temperature above threshold (ERFs). Report 0 if temperature below threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

title: Baseline total mortality
comment: To be reported as annual series of mean daily total mortality, or as a single number of mean daily mortality; to be used for computations of attributable fractions. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

title: Population
comment: Baseline population data should be provided for computations of mortality rates (i.e. deaths per total population). See Section ‎5.1.6. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

title: Burnt Area Fraction from Fire mediated land-cover change
comment: Deforestation fires

title: Carbon emitted from peat fires
comment: Should not be part of ffire

title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Fire mediated land-cover change
comment: C emitted from deforestation fires (if simulated).

title: Weighted mean fireline intensity
comment: If calculated, weighted by burned area. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

title: Carbon in different fuel classes
comment: as appropriate for your model

title: Combustion completeness of different fuel classes
comment: (between 0 and 1), fraction of fuel combusted in a fire

title: Fuel moisture for different fuel classes
comment: as a fraction of fuel dry mass (not percentage)
